title: Resale platform Vinted has transformed the way we buy clothes, for the better?
summary: The second-hand clothing platform is beating traffic records while delivering an environmentally friendly message. But it's questionable whether it's really leading to more sustainable practices.

title: Harvard president resigns amid plagiarism claims, backlash from antisemitism testimony
summary: Claudine Gay had come under pressure over testimony at a congressional hearing where she was unable to say unequivocally that calls on campus for the genocide of Jews would violate the school's conduct policy.

title: Hamas deputy head killed in Israeli strike on Beirut suburb, security officials say
summary: Hamas confirmed the death of Saleh al-Arouri's death, which Lebanese state media said came in an Israeli drone strike that killed a total of six people.

title: Donald Trump appeals Maine primary ballot ban
summary: Just like Colorado, this case is expected to eventually make its way to the United States Supreme Court.

title: Israeli Supreme Court deals major blow to Netanyahu
summary: The key provision of the government's reform aimed at reducing the power of judges was invalidated by the Supreme Court on Monday.

title: Filmmaker Paul Schrader: 'If I am gonna make a film about dying, I better hurry up'
summary: As he puts the finishing touches to his new film, "Oh, Canada," the American director and screenwriter shares his views on the state of the industry.

title: Japan: Tsunami warnings lifted but other major quake could occur
summary: Japan's Meteorological Agency advises heightened vigilance along the coastal areas stretching from Hokkaido to Kyushu.

title: Snoop Dogg to be Paris Olympics special correspondent for NBC
summary: The acclaimed rapper will reprise his star turn at the Tokyo Games that delighted viewers.

title: Israel-Hamas war: On board the 'Dixmude,' where the French navy treats Palestinian civilians
summary: This French amphibious helicopter carrier anchored off Gaza has been transformed into a hospital to treat wounded people evacuated from the Strip.

title: Israel army says it's investigating soldier over killing of detained Gazan
summary: The soldier is suspected of shooting dead a Palestinian who had been captured and detained by troops in the Gaza Strip.

title: Heavy Russian missile attacks hit Ukraine
summary: The attacks came a day after Putin said his forces would intensify strikes on military targets, in reprisals for an unprecedented Ukrainian attack over the weekend on the Russian city of Belgorod.

title: Taiwanese foreign affairs minister claims Chinese interference is increasingly sophisticated
summary: In an exclusive interview with Le Monde, Joseph Wu criticizes Beijing's failure to respect the military status quo in the Taiwan Strait but says that 'war with China is neither imminent nor inevitable.'

title: Nadal back in form after 'emotional and important' match victory
summary: The Spanish 22-time Grand Slam champion came back after a year of layoff and two rounds of hip surgery, to defeat former US Open champion Dominic Thiem 7-5, 6-1 at the Brisbane International in Australia.

title: Turkey detains 33 alleged Israeli spies
summary: The detainees have been accused of planning abductions and spying on behalf of Israel's Mossad intelligence service, as part of mounting tensions between Israel and Turkey since the October 7 terrorist attacks and Israel's assault on Gaza.

title: DRC elections: Félix Tshisekedi's large and already disputed victory
summary: The incumbent president was re-elected for a second term, according to the results issued on Sunday by the Electoral Commission. His main opponents have already announced their rejection of the December 20 election verdict.

title: Five dead in plane collision at Tokyo's Haneda Airport
summary: A passenger plane collided with a Japanese coast guard aircraft and burst into flames on the runway of the airport on Tuesday.

title: Miami is overwhelmed by its septic tanks
summary: Florida's canals and city parks have had fecal bacteria detected within them. This has been caused by rising ocean levels and intense rainfall events that have caused saturated septic systems to spread.

title: Images of the major earthquake that hit Japan
summary: More than 150 aftershocks have been recorded following the magnitude 7.6 earthquake that hit the western part of the country on January 1.

title: 'Made in Abbey' products thrive as consumers increasingly favor ethical goods
summary: Relying on local sourcing and designed with respect for the needs of people and the environment, the production model in monasteries echoes the current debate over the role of business and the workplace.

title: Macron tells Israel to avoid escalation, 'particularly in Lebanon'
summary: The warning came after an Israeli air strike in Beirut killed seven members of Hezbollah and Hamas, including the Palestinian group's deputy leader Salah al-Arouri.

title: Death toll in Japan earthquake rises to 62 as weather hinders rescue effort
summary: Nearly 32,000 people are currently in shelters as heavy rain threatens the area.

title: Sports betting fever sweeps Africa
summary: Online gambling is flourishing on the continent that is home to the world’s youngest population. It's a phenomenon with sometimes detrimental social consequences that could be borne out by the African Cup of Nations, which begins in January 2024.

title: Hospitals in Lebanon on alert over risk of war
summary: The country's Health Ministry reactivated an emergency plan to prepare the hospitals' responses in the event of escalation, after weeks of clashes on the Lebanese-Israeli border.

title: US-led multi-national force faces Houthi attacks in Red Sea
summary: Iran has deployed a warship in the wake of a deadly confrontation between the US military and Yemeni rebels in what is a vital shipping route for global commerce.

title: Cryptocurrency: After a 2023 full of scandals and ups and downs, the appetite for bitcoin is growing
summary: The main cryptoassets have seen their prices rebound in recent months, starting with bitcoin, which is in the process of being selected as an investment vehicle by world-class asset managers.

title: Le Monde's top 10 destinations | #1 France's sleeping volcanoes
summary: Where to travel in 2024? This year, Le Monde answers that question with 10 travel picks accessible by train from France. Discover two travel guides per week throughout December. Number 1: Cycling among endless volcanic sleeping beauties.

title: One day, there was a miracle: 'I walked into a bar and ordered my last beer'
summary: Jacques Alexandre, 73, remembers August 25, 1990. He was suffering from a severe addiction to alcohol but had also just fallen in love.

title: 'Hybrid war knows no peace any more than Putin knows good faith'
summary: To put an end to the war in Ukraine, insistent voices in the US suggest that Russia is ready to negotiate. This overlooks Vladimir Putin's track record in negotiations, explains Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: 'Priscilla': Portrait of a young girl under the influence of Elvis Presley
summary: Sofia Coppola weaves the story of a teenage girl locked in a gilded cage by an abusive star.

title: English doctors begin longest-ever NHS strike
summary: Junior doctors in England have begun a six-day walkout, the longest consecutive strike in the National Health Service's history, citing uneven pay rises between doctor grades, meaning 'pay cuts for many doctors.'
